list_definition.definition: a small book giving information about (how to do) something

list_ex_of_english: The handbook, including its extensive bibliography, will therefore be an invaluable resource for anyone working in this field, experienced practitioners and (advanced) students alike.
The handbook of second language acquisition pp+ 382-408!
However, it undermines a little the implicit claim both in the introduction and in the term ' handbook ' that this is a descriptive reference book.
Exercises in rethinking innateness : a handbook for connectionist simulations.
Early publications in terms of language teacher education and partnership provided useful handbooks to guide practice.
This later handbook was written with this very thing in mind.
It occurs in diaries, handbooks, and fiction without a very direct relationship to spoken language.
This is not an actors' 'handbook': it requires critical analysis on the one hand, and intuitive understanding on the other.
